problem_summary_simple: Find the largest area of a triangle formed by any three points from a given set of 2D points.
problem_summary_technical: Iterates through all combinations of three points and calculates triangle area using the Shoelace formula, keeping track of the maximum.
key_insights: The Shoelace formula (or surveyor's formula) is an efficient way to calculate the area of a polygon given its vertices.
Since the number of points is small (up to 50), a brute-force O(n^3) approach is acceptable.
The absolute value of the Shoelace formula result is taken to ensure a positive area.
